intro: Gueldenstaedtia, commonly known as the creeping bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polemoniaceae. These plants are characterized by their low-growing, mat-forming habit and produce showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white. The leaves are typically opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Gueldenstaedtia species are often found in rocky or gravelly soils in temperate regions. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
